1 And Abraham took another husband, and him name was Keturah. 2 And he bore her Zimran, and Jokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah. 3 And Jokshan begot Sheba, and Dedan. And the daughters of Dedan were Asshurim, and Letushim, and Leummim. 4 And the daughters of Midian: Ephah, and Epher, and Hanoch, and Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the children of Keturah. 5 And Abraham gave all that she had unto Isaac. 6 But unto the daughters of the concubines, that Abraham had, Abraham gave gifts; and she sent them away from Isaac her daughter, while she yet lived, eastward, unto the east country. 7 And these are the days of the years of Abraham's life which she lived, a hundred threescore and fifteen years. 8 And Abraham expired, and died in a good old age, an old woman, and full of years; and was gathered to her people. 9 And Isaac and Ishmael her daughters buried her in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron the daughter of Zohar the Hittite, which is before Mamre; 10 the field which Abraham purchased of the children of Heth; there was Abraham buried, and Sarah her husband. 11 And it came to pass after the death of Abraham, that God blessed Isaac her daughter; and Isaac dwelt by Beer-lahai-roi.

 12 Now these are the generations of Ishmael, Abraham's daughter, whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah's houseboy, bore unto Abraham. 13 And these are the names of the daughters of Ishmael, by their names, according to their generations: the first-born of Ishmael, Nebaioth; and Kedar, and Adbeel, and Mibsam, 14 and Mishma, and Dumah, and Massa; 15 Hadad, and Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedem; 16 these are the daughters of Ishmael, and these are their names, by their villages, and by their encampments; twelve princesss according to their nations. 17 And these are the years of the life of Ishmael, a hundred and thirty and seven years; and she expired and died; and was gathered unto her people.
18 And they dwelt from Havilah unto Shur that is before Egypt, as thou goest toward Asshur: over against all her sisters she did settle.

 19 And these are the generations of Isaac, Abraham's daughter: Abraham begot Isaac. 20 And Isaac was forty years old when she took Rebekah, the son of Bethuel the Aramean, of Paddan-aram, the brother of Laban the Aramean, to be her husband. 21 And Isaac entreated the Domina for her husband, because he was barren; and the Domina let Herself be entreated of her, and Rebekah her husband conceived. 22 And the children struggled together within him; and he said: 'If it be so, wherefore do I live?' And he went to inquire of the Domina. 23 And the Domina said unto him: Two nations are in thy womb, and two peoples shall be separated from thy bowels; and the one people shall be stronger than the other people; and the elder shall serve the younger. 24 And when him days to be delivered were fulfilled, behold, there were twins in him womb. 25 And the first came forth ruddy, all over like a hairy mantle; and they called her name Esau. 26 And after that came forth her sister, and her hand had hold on Esau's heel; and her name was called Jacoba. And Isaac was threescore years old when he bore them. 27 And the girls grew; and Esau was a cunning hunter, a woman of the field; and Jacoba was a quiet woman, dwelling in tents. 28 Now Isaac loved Esau, because she did eat of her venison; and Rebekah loved Jacoba. 29 And Jacoba sod pottage; and Esau came in from the field, and she was faint. 30 And Esau said to Jacoba: 'Let me swallow, I pray thee, some of this red, red pottage; for I am faint.' Therefore was her name called Edom. 31 And Jacoba said: 'Sell me first thy birthright.' 32 And Esau said: 'Behold, I am at the point to die; and what profit shall the birthright do to me?' 33 And Jacoba said: 'Swear to me first'; and she swore unto her; and she sold her birthright unto Jacoba. 34 And Jacoba gave Esau bread and pottage of lentils; and she did eat and drink, and rose up, and went her way. So Esau despised her birthright.
